name: Facility Improvements at 1890 Facilities (Sec. 1447)
objective:
1890 Facilities Grants Program provides funding for 
the acquisition and improvement of food, agricultural, natural resource, and human (FANH) science facilities and equipment, including libraries, so that the 1890 land-grant institutions, may participate fully in the research, extension, and education enterprises of the higher education system.
sub_agency_name: National Institute of Food and Agriculture
applicant_types: Public nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)
State (includes District of Columbia, public institutions of higher education and hospitals)

results.description:
SPECIAL NOTE:
See Assistance Listing # 10.500 (Q) for pertinent details.

This represents a newly created Assistance Listing (CFDA) number, which was part of an initiative to break out the separate programs formerly contained in CFDA # 10.500 – Cooperative Extension Service (CES). 

Of the appropriated $19,730,000, approximately $18,933,675 is available to support the second year (continuations) of the five year plans of work (2018-2022) from the 1890 Historically Black Land-Grant Universities (19).
$19,730,00 was appropriated in support of the facilities programs at the 1890 Land-Grant Universities as (19) continuation projects.
